meanings.definition: To treat or express in terms of geometry.
meanings.sent1: She tried to geometrize the shapes in her drawing to make them more accurate.
meanings.sent2: The architect decided to geometrize the building design to create a more visually appealing structure.
meanings.sent3: In a playful mood, he attempted to geometrize the clouds in the sky, imagining them as geometric shapes.
meanings.sent4: Her mind began to geometrize the chaos of thoughts into neat, orderly patterns.
meanings.sent5: By using rulers and protractors, she was able to geometrize the irregular shapes into precise geometric figures.

meanings.definition: To apply geometric principles or methods.
meanings.sent1: The math teacher asked the students to geometrize the problem using geometric formulas.
meanings.sent2: He decided to geometrize the garden layout to ensure symmetry and balance.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to geometrize the plating of the dish, arranging the food in geometric patterns.
meanings.sent4: Her dance movements seemed to geometrize the space around her, creating a mesmerizing geometric display.
meanings.sent5: The artist chose to geometrize the painting, incorporating geometric shapes and angles into the artwork.
